_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The BernzOmatic facility is located on a 33-acre site in the Village of Medina, New York. The facility includes a 170,000 sq. ft. main manufacturing and administrative office building and a 4,200 sq. ft. Research and Development Laboratory. The company employs approximately 200 people and manufactures a variety of hand-held torches used primarily in the plumbing industry and for other commercial and household applications.

The manufacturing facility is comprised of two main operations; a Machining Department for the machining of brass rod stock, using screw machines to produce internal and external torch components; and, an Assembly Department where a variety of torches are assembled and packaged for sale. In addition to the manufacturing operations, the main building has a Distribution Center where finished product is stored and prepared for delivery to customers, and hand held propane and propylene cylinders are stored. A Shipping and Receiving Department is also located within the main manufacturing building for receiving raw materials.   
At any given time, there may be more than 300,000 lbs of propane in various individual one to two pound cylinders at the site that are stored in close proximity to each other.  In addition, the facility also uses a number of 100-lb propane cylinders in its quality assurance and test areas for the torch assemblies. Therefore, based on the onsite inventory of propane at any given time, the BernzOmatic facility is subject to the applicability requirements of 40 CFR 68.10(b) Program 1 level facilities as described below:

Program 1: Processes which would not affect the public in the case of a worst-case release and with no accidents with specific offsite consequences within the past five years are eligible for Program 1, which imposes limited hazard assessment requirements and minimal prevention and emergency response requirements. 

It is BernzOmatic's policy to conduct all business activities, including chemical safety, in a man

ner that protects the safety and health of our employees, contractors, suppliers, customers and the public.  We are committed to providing a safe work environment where the only acceptable number of injuries is zero.  We expect our employees to work proactively to eliminate all incidents.  

A review of the BernzOmatic, Medina, NY facility accident history indicates that there has not been any accidental release of Propane (CAS# 74-98-6) from covered processes at the facility in the past five (5) years (2005-2010). 

Emergency Response Program
On Friday, February 11, 2011 a meeting was held with Mr. Paul Wagner of the Local Emergency Planning Commission (LEPC) for Orleans County and Mr. Todd Zinkievich of the city of Medina Fire Department to review the facility's Emergency Action Plan (EAP). In addition to the EAP review, a tour of the facility was conducted to identify areas where hazardous materials are stored, where safety protection systems and equipment are located (sprinkler system, fire extinguishers, exits/egress) and to provide an overview of the general manufacturing plant layout.
In addition, BernzOmatic also provides OSHA training, First Aid/ CPR/AED training, ergonomics training, emergency response training/drills etc. to its staff.
Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Ergonomic improvements, procedures, RMP/PSM training etc. will be implemented to improve the safety and heighten the awareness of the staff at the facility regarding propane/flammables management.
